articles.headline: Behind the Charges Faced by the Parents of the Michigan Shooting Suspect
articles.snippet: Prosecutors say the parents of the 15-year-old accused of killing four classmates failed to act on troubling signs. The parents pleaded not guilty to involuntary manslaughter charges.
articles.abstract: Prosecutors say the parents of the 15-year-old accused of killing four classmates failed to act on troubling signs. The parents pleaded not guilty to involuntary manslaughter charges.
articles.lead_paragraph: The gun was an early Christmas gift from his parents: a semiautomatic 9-millimeter Sig Sauer handgun. “My new beauty,” Ethan Crumbley, 15, called it.

articles.headline: A Top SoftBank Executive Wants $2 Billion in Pay. His Boss Disagrees.
articles.snippet: The SoftBank founder, Masayoshi Son, is locked in a dispute over compensation that his key deputy, Marcelo Claure, insists he should be paid.
articles.abstract: The SoftBank founder, Masayoshi Son, is locked in a dispute over compensation that his key deputy, Marcelo Claure, insists he should be paid.
articles.lead_paragraph: SoftBank, the Japanese conglomerate that became synonymous with freewheeling spending on unprofitable technology start-ups including WeWork and Uber, is trying to spend less money — starting with one of its own top executives.

articles.headline: Inside a Sequencing Lab on the Front Lines of America’s Search for Omicron
articles.snippet: More states are finding cases of the new variant. Tracking its spread, experts say, is key to understanding what threat it poses.
articles.abstract: More states are finding cases of the new variant. Tracking its spread, experts say, is key to understanding what threat it poses.
articles.lead_paragraph: OMAHA — Researchers in Nebraska had just finished sequencing six samples of the Omicron variant, the most discovered anywhere in the United States. They just didn’t know it yet.

articles.headline: Israeli Company’s Spyware Is Used to Target U.S. Embassy Employees in Africa
articles.snippet: The hack is the first known case of the spyware, known as Pegasus, being used against American officials.
articles.abstract: The hack is the first known case of the spyware, known as Pegasus, being used against American officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The iPhones of 11 U.S. Embassy employees working in Uganda were hacked using spyware developed by Israel’s NSO Group, the surveillance firm that the United States blacklisted a month ago because it said the technology had been used by foreign governments to repress dissent, several people familiar with the breach said on Friday.
articles.byline: By Katie Benner, David E. Sanger and Julian E. Barnes

articles.headline: Condé Nast Knows Faded Glory Is Not in Style
articles.snippet: Anna Wintour is the embodiment of the glory days of the magazine dynasty. Now she is pitching its global, digital future.
articles.abstract: Anna Wintour is the embodiment of the glory days of the magazine dynasty. Now she is pitching its global, digital future.
articles.lead_paragraph: Anna Wintour, the top editor of Vogue since 1988, known for her iconic bob and perma-sunglasses and exacting taste, is in many ways the embodiment of Condé Nast’s lavish history as an arbiter of style. Now she’s selling its future, where the editor in chief role she helped define is a relic, and the company operates by a code that includes the maxim: “Exceptional does not mean exclusive.”

articles.headline: Voting Battles of 2022 Take Shape as G.O.P. Crafts New Election Bills
articles.snippet: Republicans plan to carry their push to reshape the nation’s electoral system into next year, with Democrats vowing to oppose them but holding few options in G.O.P.-led states.
articles.abstract: Republicans plan to carry their push to reshape the nation’s electoral system into next year, with Democrats vowing to oppose them but holding few options in G.O.P.-led states.
articles.lead_paragraph: A new wave of Republican legislation to reshape the nation’s electoral system is coming in 2022, as the G.O.P. puts forward proposals ranging from a requirement that ballots be hand-counted in New Hampshire to the creation of a law enforcement unit in Florida to investigate allegations of voting fraud.

articles.headline: Facing Economic Collapse, Afghanistan Is Gripped by Starvation
articles.snippet: An estimated 22.8 million people — more than half the country’s population — are expected to face potentially life-threatening food insecurity this winter. Many are already on the brink of catastrophe.
articles.abstract: An estimated 22.8 million people — more than half the country’s population — are expected to face potentially life-threatening food insecurity this winter. Many are already on the brink of catastrophe.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHAH WALI KOT, Afghanistan — One by one, women poured into the mud brick clinic, the frames of famished children peeking out beneath the folds of their pale gray, blue and pink burqas.

articles.headline: CNN Fires Chris Cuomo Amid Inquiry Into His Efforts to Aid His Brother
articles.snippet: The network said it had “terminated him, effective immediately,” a move that came days after a lawyer for a former colleague accused the host of sexual misconduct.
articles.abstract: The network said it had “terminated him, effective immediately,” a move that came days after a lawyer for a former colleague accused the host of sexual misconduct.
articles.lead_paragraph: The star anchor Chris Cuomo was fired by CNN on Saturday, completing a stunning downfall for the network’s top-rated host amid a continuing inquiry into his efforts to help his brother, Andrew M. Cuomo, then the governor of New York, stave off sexual harassment accusations.
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum, John Koblin and Jodi Kantor

articles.headline: He Never Touched the Murder Weapon. Alabama Sentenced Him to Die.
articles.snippet: Nathaniel Woods was unarmed when three Birmingham police officers were fatally shot by someone else in 2004. But Woods, a Black man, was convicted of capital murder for his role in the deaths of the three white officers.
articles.abstract: Nathaniel Woods was unarmed when three Birmingham police officers were fatally shot by someone else in 2004. But Woods, a Black man, was convicted of capital murder for his role in the deaths of the three white officers.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.
articles.byline: By Dan Barry and Abby Ellin

articles.headline: On Syria’s Ruins, a Drug Empire Flourishes
articles.snippet: Powerful associates of Syria’s president, Bashar al-Assad, are making and selling captagon, an illegal amphetamine, creating a new narcostate on the Mediterranean.
articles.abstract: Powerful associates of Syria’s president, Bashar al-Assad, are making and selling captagon, an illegal amphetamine, creating a new narcostate on the Mediterranean.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Built on the ashes of 10 years of war in Syria, an illegal drug industry run by powerful associates and relatives of President Bashar al-Assad has grown into a multibillion-dollar operation, eclipsing Syria’s legal exports and turning the country into the world’s newest narcostate.
articles.byline: By Ben Hubbard and Hwaida Saad

articles.headline: Bob Dole, Old Soldier and Stalwart of the Senate, Dies at 98
articles.snippet: Mr. Dole, a son of the Kansas prairie who was left for dead on a World War II battlefield, became one of the longest-serving Republican leaders.
articles.abstract: Mr. Dole, a son of the Kansas prairie who was left for dead on a World War II battlefield, became one of the longest-serving Republican leaders.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bob Dole, the plain-spoken son of the prairie who overcame Dust Bowl deprivation in Kansas and grievous battle wounds in Italy to become the Senate majority leader and the last of the World War II generation to win his party’s nomination for president, died on Sunday. He was 98.

articles.headline: What’s Driving Putin’s Ukraine Brinkmanship?
articles.snippet: There are tactical reasons for threatening an invasion, but the real cause may lie in the Kremlin’s fixation with righting what it sees as a historical injustice.
articles.abstract: There are tactical reasons for threatening an invasion, but the real cause may lie in the Kremlin’s fixation with righting what it sees as a historical injustice.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — As the Kremlin masses troops near Ukraine, it is signaling one core conviction: Russia cares more about the fate of its southwestern neighbor than the West ever will.

articles.headline: How TikTok Reads Your Mind
articles.snippet: It’s the most successful video app in the world. Our columnist has obtained an internal company document that offers a new level of detail about how the algorithm works.
articles.abstract: It’s the most successful video app in the world. Our columnist has obtained an internal company document that offers a new level of detail about how the algorithm works.
articles.lead_paragraph: There are four main goals for TikTok’s algorithm: 用户价值, 用户价值 (长期), 作者价值, and 平台价值, which the company translates as “user value,” “long-term user value,” “creator value,” and “platform value.”

articles.headline: In Its War on Covid-19, China Calls on ‘Little Inoculated Warriors’
articles.snippet: The country regards children as crucial in its quest for herd immunity, but some parents, worried about the vaccines’ safety, are pushing back.
articles.abstract: The country regards children as crucial in its quest for herd immunity, but some parents, worried about the vaccines’ safety, are pushing back.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the rest of the world struggles to vaccinate adults in the face of a threat from a new coronavirus variant, China has embarked on an ambitious campaign that it says will give the country better protection against Covid-19: full inoculation of 160 million of its youngest citizens by the end of the year.
articles.byline: By Alexandra Stevenson and Cao Li

articles.headline: Inside Tesla as Elon Musk Pushed an Unflinching Vision for Self-Driving Cars
articles.snippet: The automaker may have undermined safety in designing its Autopilot driver-assistance system to fit its chief executive’s vision, former employees say.
articles.abstract: The automaker may have undermined safety in designing its Autopilot driver-assistance system to fit its chief executive’s vision, former employees say.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.
articles.byline: By Cade Metz and Neal E. Boudette

articles.headline: BuzzFeed’s stock falls in its public debut, offering a warning to other digital media firms.
articles.snippet: They are eyeing BuzzFeed’s market performance as they face a tough advertising climate and look for ways to pay back their early investors.
articles.abstract: They are eyeing BuzzFeed’s market performance as they face a tough advertising climate and look for ways to pay back their early investors.
articles.lead_paragraph: BuzzFeed was once on the vanguard of digital media companies that were going to leapfrog traditional publishers and change how people watched and read news and entertainment — an ambition that it struggled to fulfill.
articles.byline: By Peter Eavis, Katie Robertson and Lauren Hirsch

articles.headline: This Chemical Is in Short Supply, and the Whole World Feels It
articles.snippet: Farmers in India are desperate. Trucks in South Korea had to be idled. Food prices, already high, could rise even further.
articles.abstract: Farmers in India are desperate. Trucks in South Korea had to be idled. Food prices, already high, could rise even further.
articles.lead_paragraph: This is a story about one of those unsung forces that quietly keep the world running. It is a story about the clockwork interconnectedness of modern civilization, about how disturbances in one part of the planet can kick up storms in another.
